calculator

Class CalculatorValue

  • java.lang.Object
    • calculator.CalculatorValue

  • public class CalculatorValue
extends java.lang.Object

    Title: CalculatorValue Class.

    date 10 September 2020

    Description: A component of a JavaFX demonstration application that performs computations

    Copyright: Lynn Robert Carter, MD.Ashfak Â© 2020

    Version:
    4.0.1 2020-01-26 The JavaFX-based GUI for the implementation of a integer calculator, 4.0.2 2020-02-16 The JavaFX-based GUI for the implementation of a double calculator with Square root, 4.0.3 2020-03-30 The JavaFX-based GUI for the implementation of a double calculator with FSM, 4.0.4 2020-04-24 The JavaFX-based GUI for the implementation of a double calculator with ErrorTerm, 4.0.5 2020-09-10 The JavaFX-based GUI for the implementation of a UNumber calculator with ErrorTerm and Square root using Newton Raphson Method, 4.0.6 2020-11-28 The JavaFX-based GUI for the implementation of a UNumber calculator with Units
    Author:
    Lynn Robert Carter, MD.Ashfak

    • Constructor Detail

      • CalculatorValue

        public CalculatorValue()
        This is the default constructor

      • CalculatorValue

        public CalculatorValue(double v)
        This constructor creates a calculator value based on a long integer. For future calculators, it is best to avoid using this constructor.
        Parameters:
        v - parameter consisting long integer

      • CalculatorValue

        public CalculatorValue(CalculatorValue v)
        This copy constructor creates a duplicate of an already existing calculator value
        Parameters:
        v - parameter from which the local variables will get values

      • CalculatorValue

        public CalculatorValue(java.lang.String s,
                       java.lang.String e)
        This constructor creates a calculator value from a string... Due to the nature of the input, there is a high probability that the input has errors, so the routine returns the value with the error message value set to empty or the string of an error message.
        Parameters:
        s - string that contains the operands and will be converted to CalculatorValue
        e - string that contains the error terms and will be converted to CalculatorValue

    • Method Detail

      • checkMeasureValue

        public static java.lang.String checkMeasureValue(java.lang.String input)
        This method is a mechanical transformation of a Finite State Machine diagram into a Java method.
        Parameters:
        input - The input string for the Finite State Machine
        Returns:
        An output string that is empty if every things is okay or it will be a string with a help description of the error follow by two lines that shows the input line follow by a line with an up arrow at the point where the error was found.

      • checkerrorterm

        public static java.lang.String checkerrorterm(java.lang.String input)
        This method is a mechanical transformation of a Finite State Machine diagram into a Java method.
        Parameters:
        input - The input string for the Finite State Machine
        Returns:
        An output string that is empty if every things is okay or it will be a string with a help description of the error follow by two lines that shows the input line follow by a line with an up arrow at the point where the error was found.

      • add

        public void add(CalculatorValue v)
        This method makes an instance of the UNumber class by using its local variable. It converts the two operands into UNumber and performs standard methods for adding operands with error term.
        Parameters:
        v - the parameter which contains the 2nd operand and its error term which will be added.

      • sub

        public void sub(CalculatorValue v)
        This method makes an instance of the UNumber class by using its local variable. It converts the two operands into UNumber and performs standard methods for subtracting operands with error term.
        Parameters:
        v - the parameter which contains the 2nd operand and its error term which will be subtracted.

      • mpy

        public void mpy(CalculatorValue v)
        This method makes an instance of the UNumber class by using its local variable. It converts the two operands into UNumber and performs standard methods for multiplying operands with error term.
        Parameters:
        v - the parameter which contains the 2nd operand and its error term which will be multiplied.

      • div

        public void div(CalculatorValue v)
        This method makes an instance of the UNumber class by using its local variable. It converts the two operands into UNumber and performs standard methods for dividing operands with error term.
        Parameters:
        v - the parameter which contains the 2nd operand and its error term which will be divider.

      • square_root

        public void square_root()
        This method makes an instance of the UNumber class by using its local variable. It converts the operand into UNumber and performs Newton Rapton method from UNumber class methods for finding the square root of the operand with error term.
